result.execSummary:
The defendant John P Nelson III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant John P Nelson in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Defendant John P Nelson in custody.  Angeline E Winton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:38 am Court recites cases 16 CF 5/7 & app; Counsel rec'd copy of PSI - ADA Winton has no add/corr; Atty M - recites pg 3 deft has issues - Court so notes; ADA Winton - no contact w/victims K Graham and A Joo, sent w/h 3 yr prob on meth/CDTP and sent w/h 2 yr prob on battery; dom. viol. classes, anger mgt class, restitution; Ms. Graham makes statements; 10:46 am recess.
10:48 am Back on record.   Atty M - statements; adopt recommentation of PSI; Deft - reads statement; Court - ?'s deft, 166 days credit; Deft - statements;
ADA Winton - sentenced as well on 16 CF 07 for Ct. 2; Court so notes; Counsel - 166 days credit concurs w/amt.; 
COURT:  16 CF 05  Ct 1 Meth & Ct 2 CDTP - w/h sent. 3 yr prob., conditions: no controlled substances, no alcohol, no bars unless for employment purposes, no contact with Kathy Graham and Antel Joo, DOC assessment & follow recommendations, curfew 10 pm & 5:30 am except for employment, any and all other conditions DOC imposes, stat. costs.  No firearms possession, voter ineligibility, submit DNA sample & DNA surcharge.   
16 CF 07   Ct 2 Battery -  220 days jail, stat costs, entitled to good time - sentence complete, rest to be determined.
Warrant out of MN needs to be determined.   Call DOC.  
Adj'd 11:12 am.
Sentencing hearing on November 1, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Atty Moldenhauer offers a plea questionaire and waiver of rights form.   Court quesitons the def. re: his plea questionaire and waiver of rights. Court finds the def. freely and knowingly waives his rights.  Court finds there is a factual basis for a conviction.

Count 3-Dismissed Read-In
Count 4-Dismissed Read-In

Count 2-Def. pleas no contest. Court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty.
